trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with NetDocuments | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with NetDocuments | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use NetDocuments with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use NetDocuments with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and NetDocuments.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and NetDocuments.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A NetDocuments tenant
trans-unit.target: A NetDocuments tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to NetDocuments will be able to single sign into the application at your NetDocuments company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to NetDocuments will be able to single sign into the application at your NetDocuments company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for NetDocuments
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for NetDocuments

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for NetDocuments.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for NetDocuments.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type NetDocuments.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type NetDocuments.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select NetDocuments, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select NetDocuments, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>NetDocuments</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>NetDocuments</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to NetDocuments with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to NetDocuments with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for NetDocuments requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for NetDocuments requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the NetDocuments application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the NetDocuments application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to NetDocuments page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to NetDocuments page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your NetDocuments application (e.g.: "https://vault.netvoyage.com/neWeb2/docCent.aspx?whr=CA-JI1BG3H1").
trans-unit.target: In the Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your NetDocuments application (e.g.: "https://vault.netvoyage.com/neWeb2/docCent.aspx?whr=CA-JI1BG3H1").

trans-unit.source: In the NetDocuments Reply URL textbox, type the same value you have typed into the the Sign On URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the NetDocuments Reply URL textbox, type the same value you have typed into the the Sign On URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: You can find the correct value at the end of the Federated Identity dialog (See the screenshot for step 9).
trans-unit.target: You can find the correct value at the end of the Federated Identity dialog (See the screenshot for step 9).

trans-unit.source: Click Next
trans-unit.target: Click Next

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at NetDocuments page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at NetDocuments page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your NetDocuments company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your NetDocuments company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin.

trans-unit.source: Click Add and remove users and groups.
trans-unit.target: Click Add and remove users and groups.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Repository</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Repository</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Configure advanced authentication options.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure advanced authentication options.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure advanced authentication options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure advanced authentication options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Federated Identity dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Federated Identity dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Federated Identitty</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Federated Identitty</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Federated identity server type, select Active Directory Federation Services.
trans-unit.target: As Federated identity server type, select Active Directory Federation Services.

trans-unit.source: Click Choose file, to upload the downloaded metadata file.
trans-unit.target: Click Choose file, to upload the downloaded metadata file.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into NetDocuments, they must be provisioned into NetDocuments.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into NetDocuments, they must be provisioned into NetDocuments.

trans-unit.source: In the case of NetDocuments, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of NetDocuments, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Sing on to your NetDocuments company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sing on to your NetDocuments company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add and remove users and groups.
trans-unit.target: Click Add and remove users and groups.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Repository</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Repository</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email Address textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision, and then click Add User.
trans-unit.target: In the Email Address textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision, and then click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Email Address</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Email Address</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other NetDocuments user account creation tools or APIs provided by NetDocuments to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other NetDocuments user account creation tools or APIs provided by NetDocuments to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the NetDocuments **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the NetDocuments **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
